intro: Anchusa virginica, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist soils along streambanks and wetlands, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its hairy leaves and showy blooms make it a notable species in wetland ecosystems. Anchusa virginica is also valued for its ornamental qualities in gardens and its role in supporting pollinators.
